706808f-a.title: Brooklyn: Smith Street - Hamilton Avenue
706808f-a.text:
Smith Street towards Hamilton Avenue, fr. Centre
Street, Brooklyn.
P. L. Sperr, photographer
July 25, 190
Neg. No. A-1100
706808f-a.folder: Smith Street & Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704765f-c.title: Brooklyn: Hamilton Avenue - Smith Street
704765f-c.text:
Hamilton Avenue, east side, at Smith Street, showing plant
No. 1 of the Devoe and Raynolds Company, peint manufacturers. The
building was demolished later in the year to facilitate the widen-
ing of the avenue as part of the Belt Parkway.
ViCV1NReg.NIe A-1o26  September 7, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTICNS
(2)
The Gowanus Canal side of the factory, seen from the south end
of the bridge.
October 23, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
704765f-c.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY

704764f-a.title: Brooklyn: Hamilton Avenue - Smith Street
704764f-a.text:
Hamilton Avenue, at Smith Street (right), looking north
toward Bush Street--where buildings are being torn down--
and showing the area which is being converted into the
northern sector of the Belt Parkway. The white building is
the Devoe and Raynolds Paint Company warehouse.
October 17, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NOO REPRODUCTIONS
704764f-a.folder: Hamilton Avenue & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY
